body:
#in? has the benefit of being terse yet expressive. #not_in? isn't in the idiom of other Ruby predicates which eschew "not" when expressing the negative (e.g., unless, empty, etc.).

Set theory is concerned with "membership". Is there an affirming way of saying "not member of"? #member_of? is longer than #in? and is semantically equivalent.
On Sunday, April 10, 2011 at 2:31 PM, Evan Light wrote: 
> Oops, I meant "array has object". I got myself mixed up there for a sec thinking about #include? again. 
> 
> On Sunday, April 10, 2011 at 2:29 PM, dhh wrote:
> > How does #has? work? "object has array?" doesn't seem to work to me?
> > 
> > -- 
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> > https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/258#issuecomment-981166
> > 
>
